intro: Dinochloa orenuda, commonly known as the mountain spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which is characterized by its unique floral structures and often milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, preferring high altitudes and cooler climates. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color, and it produces capsules as its fruit. Dinochloa orenuda is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and forest edges, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
